intro: Manulea pedunculata, commonly known as the slender manulea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Manulea pedunculata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
